perturbation.original_text: This Co-Branding Agreement (the "Agreement") is entered into as of  March ___, 1999 (the "Effective Date") by and between theglobe.com, Inc., with its principal place of business at 31 West 21st Street, New York, NY  10010 ("theglobe"), and The Boxlot Company, with its principal place of business at 12626 High Bluff Drive, Suite 370, San Diego, CA  92130 ("Boxlot").
perturbation.changed_text: This Co-Branding Agreement (the "Agreement") is entered into as of  March ___, 1999 (the "Effective Date") by and between theglobe.com, Inc., with its principal place of business at 31 West 21st Street, New York, NY  10010 ("theglobe"), and The Boxlot Company, with its principal place of business at 12626 High Bluff Drive, Suite 370, San Diego, CA  92130 ("Vendor").
perturbation.explanation: In the initial definition, Boxlot is clearly identified as 'Boxlot'. By changing the designation to 'Vendor', it creates confusion throughout the document as to which entity is being referred to in subsequent sections that use either term. This introduces ambiguity, especially when obligations are assigned to 'Boxlot' in some sections and 'Vendor' in others.

perturbation.original_text: In addition, Boxlot shall indemnify theglobe against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which theglobe may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from Boxlot Banners, Boxlot Content, Boxlot Marks, the Service (excluding the Page Templates or theglobe Marks) or Boxlot's breach of Section 12.1  [Compliance with Laws].
perturbation.changed_text: In addition, the Supplier shall indemnify theglobe against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which theglobe may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from Boxlot Banners, Boxlot Content, Boxlot Marks, the Service (excluding the Page Templates or theglobe Marks) or Boxlot's breach of Section 12.1  [Compliance with Laws].
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Boxlot' is replaced with 'Supplier'. Since 'Vendor' and 'Supplier' are used interchangeably without clear definitions, it is unclear which entity is responsible for the indemnification, thus creating uncertainty in liability assignment.

perturbation.original_text: Following the Launch Date, the parties shall conduct the promotions specified in Exhibit A.
perturbation.changed_text: Following the Launch Date, the parties shall conduct the marketing campaigns specified in Exhibit A.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'promotions' to 'marketing campaigns', the contract introduces ambiguity regarding the scope and nature of the activities to be undertaken. 'Promotions' typically refers to short-term incentives, while 'marketing campaigns' encompass broader strategic efforts. This discrepancy could lead to disputes over the specific actions required of each party under Exhibit A.
